main.name: NICK RHODES
main.bio: Learn | Analyze | Design | Create. These four words best describe my work style and how I think. I believe everything we do in life is a process (daily routine, business model, etc.). I enjoy using data to extract hidden truths, display findings in a clean-attractive way for others to understand and enjoy creating scalable automated processes to continuously improve and/or build on. This is why I naturally fell in love with coding. I am currently looking for a company to continue my journey (full-stack web development or data science) and am excited to see how my business background interlocks with the coding world!
main.contactmessage: If you think I would be a good fit for your team/company or have a project for me, I would love to hear from you! You can contact me by email at Nicholas.M.Rhodes@gmail.com or by phone at (703) 472-0923.

education.description: Completed an immersive software development program with more than 1,000 hours spent learning and developing web applications using Python, MERN, and C# ASP.NET Core MVC framework.
Studies focused in Business and Finance, including Macroeconomics, Investment Analysis and Quantitative Analytics.

portfolio.portfoliomessage: Below are some of my projects and applications. You will see a mixture of websites and data science applications. The technology used is provided.

projects.title: Learn Lab
projects.description: Learn Lab is an online learning platform with a chat feature built to allow the continuation of learning during this time of uncertainty.

projects.title: Best Invest
projects.description: Best Invest is a machine learning application that helps businesses understand where they should invest their money within the organization (i.e. R&D spending, Marketing, Administration, etc.) in order to generate the greatest amount of profit.

projects.title: NFL Play Predictor
projects.description: NFL Play Predictor is a machine learning application that predicts whether the football team on offense is going to run or pass the ball. A defensive coordinatorâ€™s best friend.
